member.name: T:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration
member.summary: ConnectionConfiguration allows you to control how ElasticLowLevelClient behaves and where/how it connects to elasticsearch

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration.#ctor(System.Uri)
member.summary: ConnectionConfiguration allows you to control how ElasticLowLevelClient behaves and where/how it connects to elasticsearch
member.param: The root of the elasticsearch node we want to connect to. Defaults to http://localhost:9200

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration.#ctor(Elasticsearch.Net.IConnectionPool)
member.summary: ConnectionConfiguration allows you to control how ElasticLowLevelClient behaves and where/how it connects to elasticsearch
member.param: A connection pool implementation that'll tell the client what nodes are available

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.SniffOnConnectionFault(System.Boolean)
member.summary: On connection pools that support reseeding setting this to true (default) will resniff the cluster when a call fails

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.SniffOnStartup(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables sniffing on first usage of a connection pool if that pool supports reseeding, defaults to true

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.SniffLifeSpan(System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})
member.summary: Set the duration after which a cluster state is considered stale and a sniff should be performed again. An IConnectionPool has to signal it supports reseeding otherwise sniffing will never happen. Defaults to 1 hour. Set to null to disable completely. Sniffing will only ever happen on ConnectionPools that return true for SupportsReseeding
member.param: The duration a clusterstate is considered fresh, set to null to disable periodic sniffing

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.EnableHttpCompression(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Enable gzip compressed requests and responses, do note that you need to configure elasticsearch to set this
http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/modules-http.html"

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.ThrowExceptions(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Instead of following a c/go like error checking on response.IsValid always throw an exception on the client when a call resulted in an exception on either the client or the Elasticsearch server.
Reasons for such exceptions could be search parser errors, index missing exceptions, etc...

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.DisablePing(System.Boolean)
member.summary: When a node is used for the very first time or when it's used for the first time after it has been marked dead a ping with a very low timeout is send to the node to make sure that when it's still dead it reports it as fast as possible. You can disable these pings globally here if you rather have it fail on the possible slower original request

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.GlobalQueryStringParameters(System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection)
member.summary: This NameValueCollection will be appended to every url NEST calls, great if you need to pass i.e an API key.

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.GlobalHeaders(System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection)
member.summary: a NameValueCollection that will be send as headers for each request

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.RequestTimeout(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Sets the default timeout in milliseconds for each request to Elasticsearch. NOTE: You can set this to a high value here, and specify the timeout on Elasticsearch's side.
member.param: time out in milliseconds

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.PingTimeout(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Sets the default ping timeout in milliseconds for ping requests, which are used to determine whether a node is alive. Pings should fail as fast as possible.
member.param: The ping timeout in milliseconds defaults to 1000, or 2000 is using SSL.

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.DeadTimeout(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Sets the default dead timeout factor when a node has been marked dead.
member.remarks: Some connection pools may use a flat timeout whilst others take this factor and increase it exponentially

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.MaxDeadTimeout(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Sets the maximum time a node can be marked dead. Different implementations of IConnectionPool may choose a different default.
member.param: The timeout in milliseconds

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.MaxRetryTimeout(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary:
Limits the total runtime including retries separately from
When not specified defaults to which itself defaults to 60seconds

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.Proxy(System.Uri,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: If your connection has to go through proxy use this method to specify the proxy url

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.PrettyJson(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Forces all requests to have ?pretty=true, causing elasticsearch to return formatted json. Also forces the client to send out formatted json. Defaults to false

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.DisableDirectStreaming(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Make sure the reponse bytes are always available on the ElasticsearchResponse object
Note: that depending on the registered serializer this may cause the respond to be read in memory first

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.OnRequestCompleted(System.Action{Elasticsearch.Net.IApiCallDetails})
member.summary: Global callback for every response that NEST receives, useful for custom logging. Calling this multiple times will register multiple listeners.

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.BasicAuthentication(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Basic access authentication credentials to specify with all requests.

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionConfiguration`1.EnableHttpPipelining(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Allows for requests to be pipelined. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTP_pipelining
Note: HTTP pipelining must also be enabled in Elasticsearch for this to work properly.

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IConnectionConfigurationValues.BootstrapLock
member.summary: Provides a semaphoreslim to transport implementations that need to limit access to a resource

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IConnectionConfigurationValues.ConnectionPool
member.summary: The connection pool to use when talking with elasticsearch

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IConnectionConfigurationValues.Connection
member.summary: The connection implementation to use when talking with elasticsearch

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IConnectionConfigurationValues.Serializer
member.summary: The serializer to use to serialize requests and deserialize responses

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IConnectionConfigurationValues.RequestTimeout
member.summary: The timeout in milliseconds for each request to Elasticsearch

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IConnectionConfigurationValues.PingTimeout
member.summary: The timeout in milliseconds to use for ping requests, which are issued to determine whether a node is alive

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IConnectionConfigurationValues.DeadTimeout
member.summary: The time to put dead nodes out of rotation (this will be multiplied by the number of times they've been dead)

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IConnectionConfigurationValues.MaxDeadTimeout
member.summary: The maximum ammount of time a node is allowed to marked dead

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IConnectionConfigurationValues.MaxRetryTimeout
member.summary:
Limits the total runtime including retries separately from
When not specified defaults to which itself defaults to 60 seconds

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IConnectionConfigurationValues.MaxRetries
member.summary: When a retryable exception occurs or status code is returned this controls the maximum amount of times we should retry the call to elasticsearch

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IConnectionConfigurationValues.DisablePings
member.summary: This signals that we do not want to send initial pings to unknown/previously dead nodes and just send the call straightaway

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IConnectionConfigurationValues.EnableHttpCompression
member.summary:
Enable gzip compressed requests and responses, do note that you need to configure elasticsearch to set this
http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/modules-http.html

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IConnectionConfigurationValues.ProxyAddress
member.summary: When set will force all connections through this proxy

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IConnectionConfigurationValues.PrettyJson
member.summary: Forces all requests to have ?pretty=true, causing elasticsearch to return formatted json. Also forces the client to send out formatted json. Defaults to false

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IConnectionConfigurationValues.DisableDirectStreaming
member.summary: When set to true will disable (de)serializing directly to the request and response stream and return a byte[] copy of the raw request and response on elasticsearch calls. Defaults to false

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IConnectionConfigurationValues.DisableAutomaticProxyDetection
member.summary: Disabled proxy detection on the webrequest, in some cases this may speed up the first connection your appdomain makes, in other cases it will actually increase the time for the first connection. No silver bullet! use with care!

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IConnectionConfigurationValues.HttpPipeliningEnabled
member.summary: By default the client enables http pipelining as elasticsearch 2.0 defaults to true as well

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IConnectionConfigurationValues.ThrowExceptions
member.summary:
Instead of following a c/go like error checking on response.IsValid always throw an exception on the client when a call resulted in an exception on either the client or the Elasticsearch server.
Reasons for such exceptions could be search parser errors, index missing exceptions, etc...

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IConnectionConfigurationValues.SniffsOnStartup
member.summary: Sniff the cluster state immediatly on startup

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IConnectionConfigurationValues.SniffsOnConnectionFault
member.summary: Force a new sniff for the cluster state everytime a connection dies

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IConnectionConfigurationValues.SniffInformationLifeSpan
member.summary: Force a new sniff for the cluster when the cluster state information is older than the specified timespan

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IConnectionConfigurationValues.QueryStringParameters
member.summary: Append these query string parameters automatically to every request

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IConnectionConfigurationValues.Headers
member.summary: Try to send these headers for every request

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IConnectionConfigurationValues.OnRequestCompleted
member.summary: Allows you to register a callback every time a an API call is returned

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IConnectionConfigurationValues.BasicAuthenticationCredentials
member.summary: Basic access authorization credentials to specify with all requests.

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IConnectionConfigurationValues.KeepAliveTime
member.summary: KeepAliveTime - specifies the timeout, in milliseconds, with no activity until the first keep-alive packet is sent.

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IConnectionConfigurationValues.KeepAliveInterval
member.summary: KeepAliveInterval - specifies the interval, in milliseconds, between when successive keep-alive packets are sent if no acknowledgement is received.

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IRequestConfiguration.RequestTimeout
member.summary: The timeout for this specific request, takes precedence over the global timeout settings

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IRequestConfiguration.PingTimeout
member.summary: The ping timeout for this specific request

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IRequestConfiguration.ContentType
member.summary: Force a difference content type header on the request

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IRequestConfiguration.MaxRetries
member.summary: This will override whatever is set on the connection configuration or whatever default the connectionpool has.

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IRequestConfiguration.ForceNode
member.summary: This will force the operation on the specified node, this will bypass any configured connection pool and will no retry.

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IRequestConfiguration.DisableSniff
member.summary: Forces no sniffing to occur on the request no matter what configuration is in place globally

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IRequestConfiguration.DisablePing
member.summary: Under no circumstance do a ping before the actual call. If a node was previously dead a small ping with low connect timeout will be tried first in normal circumstances

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IRequestConfiguration.AllowedStatusCodes
member.summary: Treat the following statuses (on top of the 200 range) NOT as error.

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IRequestConfiguration.BasicAuthenticationCredentials
member.summary: Basic access authorization credentials to specify with this request. Overrides any credentials that are set at the global IConnectionSettings level.

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IRequestConfiguration.EnableHttpPipelining
member.summary: Whether or not this request should be pipelined. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTP_pipelining defaults to true

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IRequestConfiguration.CancellationToken
member.summary: The cancellation token to use to internally to cancel async operations

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IRequestConfiguration.RunAs
member.summary: Submit the request on behalf in the context of a different shield user https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/shield/current/submitting-requests-for-other-users.html

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.RequestConfiguration.RunAs
member.summary: Submit the request on behalf in the context of a different user https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/shield/current/submitting-requests-for-other-users.html

member.summary: Submit the request on behalf in the context of a different shield user https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/shield/current/submitting-requests-for-other-users.html

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IConnectionPool.Nodes
member.summary: Returns a readonly constant view of all the nodes in the cluster, this might involve creating copies of the nodes e.g if you are using the sniffing connectionpool. If you do not need an isolated copy of the nodes please read `CreateView()` to completion

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IConnectionPool.MaxRetries
member.summary: Returns the default maximum retries for the connection pool implementation. Most implementation default to number of nodes, note that this can be overidden in the connection settings

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IConnectionPool.SupportsReseeding
member.summary: Signals that this implemenation can accept new nodes

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IConnectionPool.UsingSsl
member.summary: Whether or not SSL is being using

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.IConnectionPool.SniffedOnStartup
member.summary: Bookkeeps wheter this connectionpool has seen a sniff on startup. its up to to the callee to set this in a threadsafe fashion

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.IConnectionPool.CreateView(System.Action{Elasticsearch.Net.AuditEvent,Elasticsearch.Net.Node})
member.summary: Creates a view with changing starting positions that wraps over on each call e.g Thread A might get 1,2,3,4,5 and thread B will get 2,3,4,5,1. if there are no live nodes yields a different dead node to try once

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.IConnectionPool.Reseed(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Elasticsearch.Net.Node})
member.summary: Update the node list, it's the IConnectionPool's responsibility to do so in a threadsafe fashion

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.Node.IsResurrected
member.summary: When set this signals the transport that a ping before first usage would be wise

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.Node.HttpEnabled
member.summary: Whether HTTP is enabled on the node or not

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.Node.HoldsData
member.summary: Indicates whether this node holds data, defaults to true when unknown/unspecified

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.Node.MasterEligible
member.summary: Indicates whether this node is master eligible, defaults to true when unknown/unspecified

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.Node.Id
member.summary: The id of the node, defaults to null when unknown/unspecified

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.Node.Name
member.summary: The name of the node, defaults to null when unknown/unspecified

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.Node.FailedAttempts
member.summary: The number of failed attempts trying to use this node, resets when a node is marked alive

member.name: P:Elasticsearch.Net.Node.DeadUntil
member.summary: When marked dead this reflects the date that the node has to be taken out of rotation till

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.StaticConnectionPool.CreateView(System.Action{Elasticsearch.Net.AuditEvent,Elasticsearch.Net.Node})
member.summary: Creates a view of all the live nodes with changing starting positions that wraps over on each call e.g Thread A might get 1,2,3,4,5 and thread B will get 2,3,4,5,1. if there are no live nodes yields a different dead node to try once

http://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/master/indices-flush.html

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.FlushRequestParameters.Force(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether a flush should be forced even if it is not necessarily needed ie. if no changes will be committed to the index. This is useful if transaction log IDs should be incremented even if no uncommitted changes are present. (This setting can be considered as internal)

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.FlushRequestParameters.WaitIfOngoing(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If set to true the flush operation will block until the flush can be executed if another flush operation is already executing. The default is false and will cause an exception to be thrown on the shard level if another flush operation is already running.

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.FlushRequestParameters.IgnoreUnavailable(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether specified concrete indices should be ignored when unavailable (missing or closed)

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.FlushRequestParameters.AllowNoIndices(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether to ignore if a wildcard indices expression resolves into no concrete indices. (This includes `_all` string or when no indices have been specified)

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.FlushRequestParameters.ExpandWildcards(Elasticsearch.Net.ExpandWildcards)
member.summary: Whether to expand wildcard expression to concrete indices that are open, closed or both.

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.FlushRequestParameters.Source(System.String)
member.summary: The URL-encoded request definition

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.FlushRequestParameters.FilterPath(System.String)
member.summary: Comma separated list of filters used to reduce the response returned by Elasticsearch

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.ElasticLowLevelClient.Bulk``1(Elasticsearch.Net.PostData{System.Object},System.Func{Elasticsearch.Net.BulkRequestParameters,Elasticsearch.Net.BulkRequestParameters})
member.summary:
Represents a POST on /_bulk
Returns: ElasticsearchResponse<T> where the behavior depends on the type of T:
- T, an object you own that the elasticsearch response will be deserialized to
- byte[], no deserialization, but the response stream will be closed
- Stream, no deserialization, response stream is your responsibility
- VoidResponse, no deserialization, response stream never read and closed
- DynamicDictionary, a dynamic aware dictionary that can be safely traversed to any depth
See also: http://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/master/docs-bulk.html
member.param: The operation definition and data (action-data pairs), separated by newlines
A func that allows you to describe the querystring parameters & request specific connection settings.

Returns: ElasticsearchResponse<T> where the behavior depends on the type of T:
- T, an object you own that the elasticsearch response will be deserialized to
- byte[], no deserialization, but the response stream will be closed
- Stream, no deserialization, response stream is your responsibility
- VoidResponse, no deserialization, response stream never read and closed
- DynamicDictionary, a dynamic aware dictionary that can be safely traversed to any depth
See also: http://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/master/search-search.html
member.param: The search definition using the Query DSL
A func that allows you to describe the querystring parameters & request specific connection settings.

Returns: ElasticsearchResponse<T> where the behavior depends on the type of T:
- T, an object you own that the elasticsearch response will be deserialized to
- byte[], no deserialization, but the response stream will be closed
- Stream, no deserialization, response stream is your responsibility
- VoidResponse, no deserialization, response stream never read and closed
- DynamicDictionary, a dynamic aware dictionary that can be safely traversed to any depth
See also: http://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/search-template.html
member.param: A func that allows you to describe the querystring parameters & request specific connection settings.

Represents a GET on /{index}/{type}/{id}/_source
Returns: ElasticsearchResponse<T> where the behavior depends on the type of T:
- T, an object you own that the elasticsearch response will be deserialized to
- byte[], no deserialization, but the response stream will be closed
- Stream, no deserialization, response stream is your responsibility
- VoidResponse, no deserialization, response stream never read and closed
- DynamicDictionary, a dynamic aware dictionary that can be safely traversed to any depth
See also: http://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/master/docs-get.html
member.param: The name of the index
The type of the document; use `_all` to fetch the first document matching the ID across all types
The document ID
A func that allows you to describe the querystring parameters & request specific connection settings.

member.name: M:Elasticsearch.Net.IElasticLowLevelClient.ShieldPutUserPostAsync``1(System.String,Elasticsearch.Net.PostData{System.Object},System.Func{Elasticsearch.Net.PutUserRequestParameters,Elasticsearch.Net.PutUserRequestParameters})
member.summary:
Represents a POST on /_shield/user/{username}
Returns: A task of ElasticsearchResponse<T> where the behaviour depends on the type of T:
- T, an object you own that the elasticsearch response will be deserialized to
- byte[], no deserialization, but the response stream will be closed
- Stream, no deserialization, response stream is your responsibility
- VoidResponse, no deserialization, response stream never read and closed
- DynamicDictionary, a dynamic aware dictionary that can be safely traversed to any depth
See also: Update or create a user for the native shield realm
member.param: The username of the User

member.name: T:Elasticsearch.Net.SimpleJson
member.summary:
This class encodes and decodes JSON strings. Spec. details, see http://www.json.org/
JSON uses Arrays and Objects. These correspond here to the datatypes JsonArray(IList<object>) and JsonObject(IDictionary<string,object>). All numbers are parsed to doubles.

member.name: T:Purify.Purifier
member.summary:
The Uri classes in .NET prior to 4.5 and Mono scrub through your Uris and modify them in order to prevent vulnerabilities, for example escaped slashes are unescaped. This scrubbing however prevents Uris that are inline with RFC 3986. Beyond that it prevents using .NET's HTTP clients (HttpClient and WebClient) to talk to APIs that require accessing resources using escaped slashes unless you are using .NET 4.5.
This static class allows you to purify a Uri instance so that it remains untouched across all .NET runtime versions

member.name: M:Purify.Purifier.Purify(System.Uri)
member.summary: Will purify the to the unscrubed version. Calling this will be a NOOP on .NET 4.5 and up.
member.param: The uri to be purified
member.returns: The purified uri

member.name: M:Purify.Purifier.IPurifier.Purify(System.Uri)
member.summary: purifies and returns the passed
